title: At the very least, 'unstoppable' ults should be able to break out of Camille's ult.

replies.body: I'm a Sion main. I'm fine with her ult doing what it does. I know not to waste my abilities to try and escape.

But it sure feels like you should be able to smash through

Why?

It's not stopping them with any sort of CC. It's not a knockdown, grounding, stun, silence, or any other sort of ability prevention/nullification.

Camille's ultimate basically creates an incredibly thick ring of walls around the target. You can't Flash across a wall a million units thick. You can't Malph ult or Kass ult or any other transportation ability across it either.

I honestly think her ult is quite a big issue.
Camile looks pretty balanced to me without that ult, but that ult means if she ever is in a state to kill you, you simply can't allow her to get on the same screen or you die with no way to avoid that.
And on top of that, it also gives quite nice teamfight utillity, especially with tanky builts, due to the heavy lockdown(that shit can even make ap-pant work as his ult becomes a save hit)
It's just a very low counterplay abillity, which is made worse by her huge engage range with W.
There are only two options: tank it out - vs a champ with %damage and high truedamage, or fight back vs a champ that is designed to be superior 1v1 vs almost anyone.
This means grouping is prettymuch the only way to deal with her, and in order to be overall balanced, she has to be quite bad vs grouped oppponents, which will lead to tryn 2.0, splitpushing 24/7...
